comment.author: 39839593@N00
comment._content: Called "The Three Gables" on St. Margaret's Street in Bradford upon Avon. Present-day view from Google Streetview An article about the building: www.wiltshiretimes.co.uk/news/4711617.Bistro_plan_for_Bra...

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/govert1970] Michiel, once again you have helped us, that's so great! The article you linked to (from Wiltshire Times) tells that the building is a former tearoom, and indeed the sign on the building in the photo above says: "Dainty Teas at The Three Gables". Today, it seems to be a restaurant. Now we now a lot more about the building, thanks to you. Still, it  would be nice to know about its age.
/Anna B.

comment.author: 31821335@N02
comment._content:
These buildings were originally three sparate houses, being built in approx.1740 Later interconnected to form one larger property. The building is now 
Grade 2 listed by English Heritage. It is now a Restaurant .
comment.authorname: richwall100 - Thank you all for 1,000,000 views

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/richwall100] Thank you for giving us the age of the building! Also very interesting to know that three buildings were joined into one, which explains the structure with the three gables. More about listed historical buildings at the English Heritage web site. /Anna B.

comment._content:

/Anna B.
